abstract: Global long-haul travel grew by 40 percent from 2000 to 2010, one trade group said, but the United States’ share of growth fell to 12.4 percent from 17 percent.
snippet: Global long-haul travel grew by 40 percent from 2000 to 2010, one trade group said, but the United States’ share of growth fell to 12.4 percent from 17 percent.
lead_paragraph: Travel groups and convention planners are among the groups pressing the United States to change some of its more onerous visa requirements, arguing that the current rules are keeping out many international business travelers and that a faster, more efficient process would help American companies compete in the global marketplace.
